parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To be favorable, be kindly-disposed. From a compound of eu and nous; to be well- minded, i.e. Reconcile.
Quickly, speedily. Neuter singular of tachus; shortly, i.e. Without delay, soon, or suddenly, or readily.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
An opponent (at law), an adversary. From anti and dike; an opponent; specially, Satan.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
An opponent (at law), an adversary. From anti and dike; an opponent; specially, Satan.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A judge, magistrate, ruler. From krino; a judge.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A judge, magistrate, ruler. From krino; a judge.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From hupo and a derivative of eresso; an under-oarsman, i.e. subordinate.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From phulasso; a guarding or, the act, the person; figuratively, the place, the condition, or, the time, literally or figuratively.
